text: Hello everyone. This is Minoo at Anglo-Link.
Welcome to Lesson 6 in my EZZE series.
As you know by now, this series is about deleting some common mistakes
from your written and spoken English
so you can communicate in English more confidently.
Okay! With that in mind, let's look at today's topic,
which is the common confusion about questions with
'who' and 'what'.
These two question words sometimes need an auxiliary verb
and sometimes don't. For example:
'Who did he speak to?'
'Who spoke to him?'
Let's find out how to formulate the right type of question each time.

Well, that's the end of the lesson. 
I hope you've enjoyed it.
If you feel you need to review all the question forms,
have a look at my complete lesson called 'Questions' on my YouTube channel.

If you would like to access all my lessons 
including additional exercises and tests,
you're very welcome to join my online course at
anglo-link com.
You will find all the links in the description box.
And, if you would like to be notified when the next EZEE lesson is online,

please subscribe to my channel and allow 
notifications.
Thanks a lot for watching this lesson, and I'll see you soon in my next lesson.
Happy studies everyone, and goodbye for now.
